intro: Orthilia elatior, commonly known as the greater orthilia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Orthilia elatior is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
